title: Keweenaw National Historical Park: Education
body: Education Once a bustling copper mining district, now can be a valuable and powerful resource for teachers!  Copper Country History, American History, Mining Technology, Geology, Labor Relations. Do you cover any of these topics? We can help! Plan a Field Trip to the Calumet Visitor Center. Guest Speakers are a great way to learn. Additional information is available in Curriculum Materials.                    Education Transportation Reimbursement The Park's Advisory Commission has made it possible for all students to visit Keweenaw National Historical Park and our Heritage Sites for free. Read More        Keweenaw Heritage Sites Dozens of cultural sites are found along the length of the Keweenaw Peninsula. Read More        Calumet Visitor Center Visitors may spend anywhere from a half hour to several hours touring the facility. Operating days and hours change by the season, check here first. Read More        Find us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter Visitors can find up-to-date park and program information on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. Read More
